intro: Diporidium comorense, commonly known as the Comoros diporidium, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
